page.title: 03INDUSTRY:BOATS AND FISHING
page.content: The fish goes to Plymouth fish market by lorry,and only a little is sold locally.Here are the main landings in tons at Looe from 1981-84:-monkfish 670;lemon sole 478;whiting 128;squid 120;plaice 117;dover sole 27.5;cod 80; turbot 50;pollack 112;conger 240; mackerel 7000.8000 x dozen scallops were also caught in this period,also a large amount of crab and lobster.Some of the fish (but not shellfish)were caught by hand lines (e.g.mackerel) longlines and moored bottom nets.We couldn't find actual figures for crab and lobster,but there are seven boats fishing for these.There are twenty- eight boats who do either handlining, longlining or moored net fishing.we found that the older fishermen do not like some modern methods like trawling and moored monofilament nets.They say these destroy fish stocks. (see P.4)
